A man is looking at a picture of someone. His friend asks, 'Who is it you are looking at?' The man replies, 'Brothers and sisters, I have none. But the father of that person in the picture is my father's son.' Who is in the picture?
Which number comes next in the sequence: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?

You see a house with two doors. One door leads to certain death, the other to freedom. Two guards know which is which: one always tells the truth, the other always lies. You can ask one guard one question. What do you ask?
options: Which door would the other guard say leads to freedom?
Can I go through both doors?

question: What English word retains the same pronunciation, even after you take away four of its five letters?

A train leaves New York at 8:00 AM heading west at 90 mph. Another train leaves Los Angeles at 8:00 AM heading east at 110 mph. The distance between the cities is 2,800 miles. When they meet, which train is closer to New York?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
You measure my life in hours and I serve you by expiring. I'm quick when I'm thin and slow when I'm fat. The wind is my enemy. What am I?
I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?
What disappears as soon as you say its name?
The more of this there is, the less you see. What is it?
